clear_requirements.text: Understand the business goals, objectives and success criteria
Engage stakeholders by organizing interviews to understand the data needs and challenges
Assess the current state by deep diving into data sources, infrastructure, mapping documents
Analyze the quality and accuracy of the data in the current state
Understand and review documents related to enterprise architecture standards & guidelines to create Flowmart future state
Creating future state architecture for Flowmart
Create an implementation, Future Feature / Capability Roadmap
Detail program objectives and qualitative and quantitative success metrics
Engage key stakeholders from different departments to understand their data needs and challenges
Conduct interviews or workshops to gather insights into current frustrations or limitations with existing data and analytics tools and processes?
Business Units and Business Processes to be supported
Future state features and capabilities
Disposition of current features / capabilities, especially legacy features.
Scope inclusive for all Small Commercial system like – Select, Ag, NL/NF.
Understand approved enterprise architecture standards and guidelines, and compliance requirements
Understand approved products, platforms and tools
Capture Flows and dependencies
Current Business Processes captured as Information Flows and System Flows.
Systems integrated with Flowmart and how data flows into Flowmart.
Current consumers of Flowmart and how they consume data from Flowmart.
Current Technology Architecture and Landscape.
Regulatory and Compliance requirements. Assess security requirements for Flowmart, including access control and encryption.
Future state Business Processes and Technical Capabilities.
Assess dependencies and interdependencies with upstream and downstream systems.
Systems and Consumers likely impacted
Build High level source to target mapping and flow
Analyzing the quality, accuracy, and integrity of the data stored within the system and proposing measures to ensure data consistency​
Review and evaluate the current data platform architecture.
Define how it will interact with master data from different sources.
Guiding Principles such as scalability, security, interoperability, and user experience (for consumers of data).
Reference Architecture with focus on event based and data products architecture.
Application of Well Architected Guidelines and Principles (Performance Efficiency, Security, Operational Excellence, Reliability, Cost Optimization/FinOps, Sustainability).
Decompose Reference Architecture into design patterns.
Map design patterns to appropriate run time products and tools.
Data Strategy, Data Architecture, Modeling and Mapping.
Technology Stack Fitment consistent with Travelers approved products, platforms and tools.
Implementation Strategies and Options.
Data Migration Approach with potentially a phased migration that includes a pilot/test environment before full-scale deployment.
Transition and Cut Over strategies.
Post Implementation Support needs.
Post Implementation Training / Re-training needs.
Change Management Planning.
Provide Future Feature / Capability Roadmap
Create Feature / Capability Prioritization along with Traveler stakeholders
High Level Future State Architecture approved by Travelers IT
Develop a preliminary timeline & milestone for the Flowmart Modernization implementation, including data migration.
Ensure alignment with the organization's broader engagement timelines and objectives
High-level cost ROM estimate for implementation, including Tools and technologies
Document outlining modernization goals, expected outcomes, and KPIs.
Comprehensive scope document detailing business processes, features, and future capabilities to be addressed.
Current-state mapping of business flows, system integrations, data consumers, and technology architecture.
Report on alignment with enterprise standards, including gaps and recommendations for compliance.
High-level architecture adhering to guiding principles and well-architected frameworks.
Evaluation of technology stack options and alignment with EA guidelines.
Strategies for implementation, data migration, cut-over, and post-implementation support.
Phased roadmap with prioritized features, timelines, and milestones.
High-level migration steps and transition strategies.
Comprehensive details required for creating a Request for Proposal.
Recommendations for governance and ongoing improvement.
Get Required Access to Systems/Documents
Workshop with Business / Application Teams of SCBP, Select, PPL PIF and Analytics to understand the data feeds
Survey and interview with key critical applications owners
Workshop with Business / Application Teams to understand Data Needs / Reporting Requirements from FlowMart
Workshop / Meetings to understand process of meeting current demand, current state of technology & infrastructure; data connectivity, assets, catalogue and desirable features.
Understanding of Current Tools, Data Model, Data Policy across Data Value Chain
Preparation of Data Needs / Reporting Requirements List

Preparation of As-Is Tech. Landscape including Capabilities assessment across all pillars including Data Architecture, Data Consumption Layers, Catalog, Ingestion, Prescriptive Analytics, Cloud Maturity, and the respective prioritization
Categorizing the Data Needs as per Business Departments / Data Types Frequency / Criticality etc.
Analyzing the Existing Data Sources, Application Platforms & Integration to produce future planning
Discoverability and Provisioning of Technology Tooling, People & Capacity required
Technical Capabilities Mapping to meet the Data Needs – Final / To-Be Tech Stack Assessment, Data Model Assessment, Security & Compliance Assessment
Preparation of To-Be Technology Landscape / Enterprise Architecture
Define key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success and effectiveness of FlowMart Implementation
FlowMart Modernization Strategic Roadmap covering
Recommendation on To-Be process/Operating Model
Roadmap (Interim / Long Term) for catering to the prioritized data needs
High-level architecture for FlowMart Modernization
Develop a preliminary timeline & milestone for the implementation of FlowMart Modernization.
Ensure alignment with the organization's broader engagement timelines and objectives
Key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success and effectiveness of FlowMart Modernization.
Documentation validation and ability to Reproduce results

ambiguous_requirements.text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
ambiguous_requirements.reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: What specific risk categories (e.g., technical, operational, financial, security, data migration) should be considered when identifying 'possible risks' for the implementation strategy?
questions.context: Clarifies the scope of risk assessment to ensure comprehensive coverage and prevent overlooking critical areas. This relates directly to the ambiguity in REQ-07 and ensures specific criteria are used for risk identification.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: Can you provide examples of 'Challenges' encountered in previous modernization projects that are relevant to Flowmart, and how were those challenges addressed?
questions.context: Helps anticipate potential roadblocks and leverage past experiences to develop proactive mitigation strategies. This also ties back to understanding the current limitations and pain points mentioned in the needs assessment report.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: Regarding the 'Approach' section, should we follow a specific SDLC methodology (e.g., Agile, Waterfall, Iterative)? If so, please provide details regarding Travelers' preferred methodology and any specific artifacts or processes that are expected.
questions.context: Defines the development lifecycle to be followed, ensuring alignment with Travelers' standards and streamlining the implementation process. This question also connects to REQ-05, ensuring the 'Approach' adheres to EA guidelines.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: For the 'cutover strategy', what are the acceptable downtime windows for Flowmart, and are there any dependencies on other systems that need to be considered during the cutover?
questions.context: Defines critical parameters for the cutover strategy, ensuring minimal disruption to business operations. Understanding system dependencies is crucial for a smooth transition. This also aligns with the need to map system integrations as part of the needs assessment.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: What level of detail is expected for the 'Implementation Strategy'? Should it include specific tasks, resource allocation, and timelines, or is a high-level overview sufficient at this stage?
questions.context: Clarifies the deliverable expectations for the 'Implementation Strategy' to ensure the document meets Travelers' needs and avoids unnecessary effort. This question makes the deliverable clear.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: What are the key performance indicators (KPIs) that will be used to measure the success of the implementation, and how will these KPIs be tracked and reported?
questions.context: Ensures that the implementation strategy aligns with the overall program objectives and success metrics (REQ-09). It also enables the development of a plan to monitor and report on progress against these KPIs.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: Regarding data migration, what data quality checks and validation processes are required before, during, and after the cutover to ensure data integrity?
questions.context: Identifies critical aspects of data migration to prevent data loss or corruption, which is a major risk in modernization projects. This needs specific attention for a good cutover strategy.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: Are there any regulatory compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, CCPA) that need to be considered when developing the implementation strategy, particularly regarding data handling and security?
questions.context: Ensures compliance with relevant regulations, mitigating legal and reputational risks. It's important to include it as compliance risks are often overlooked.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: What specific tools or technologies are mandated or preferred by Travelers for project management, collaboration, and risk management during the implementation?
questions.context: Ensures the team uses compatible tools and aligns with Travelers' IT infrastructure and processes. This helps in smoother project execution and collaboration.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.question: What is the communication protocol between Yash Technologies and Travelers during the project and how often the status and escalations has to be shared?
questions.context: Ensures project progress transparency and escalations will happen as per protocol. This helps in managing potential risk and helps keep project go smooth.
questions.source_text: Create a engagement plan & Approach: Implementation Strategy, possible risks, Challenges, Approach, and cutover strategy.
questions.ambiguity_reason: The term 'possible risks' is ambiguous. Needs specifics on risk identification criteria.

questions.item: "Proper performance and delivery of the services described in this Work Assignment ("Services")"
questions.question: Can we get a list of the specific KPIs or metrics that will be used to measure the 'proper performance' of the services? What are the acceptable thresholds for each metric?
questions.context: Without defining 'proper performance' with measurable metrics, the Supplier could be held accountable to subjective standards, leading to disputes.
questions.source_text: "Proper performance and delivery of the services described in this Work Assignment ("Services")"
questions.boundary_item: "Proper performance and delivery of the services described in this Work Assignment ("Services")"

questions.item: "Engage stakeholders"
questions.question: Can Travelers provide a list of the specific stakeholders who need to be engaged, their roles, and the estimated time commitment expected from each during the engagement?
questions.context: Understanding the number of stakeholders and their expected involvement will help the Supplier allocate resources appropriately and avoid scope creep.
questions.source_text: "Engage stakeholders"
questions.boundary_item: "Engage stakeholders"

questions.item: "Deep diving into data sources"
questions.question: Could you provide a list of the specific data sources that require a deep dive, and the expected level of detail for the analysis of each (e.g., data dictionary review, full data profiling, sample data analysis)?
questions.context: Clarifying the scope of the data source analysis will prevent the Supplier from spending excessive time on low-value data sources or missing critical sources.
questions.source_text: "Deep diving into data sources"
questions.boundary_item: "Deep diving into data sources"

questions.item: "Analyzing the quality and accuracy of the data"
questions.question: What specific data quality dimensions (e.g., completeness, accuracy, consistency, timeliness) are most important to Travelers, and what are the minimum acceptable thresholds for each dimension?
questions.context: Defining the acceptable level of data quality is crucial for setting realistic expectations and avoiding endless analysis. It also informs the level of effort required.
questions.source_text: "Analyzing the quality and accuracy of the data"
questions.boundary_item: "Analyzing the quality and accuracy of the data"

questions.item: "Enterprise architecture standards & guidelines"
questions.question: If the Supplier identifies deviations from the Travelers' enterprise architecture standards, is the Supplier responsible for proposing solutions, documenting the deviations and recommending exceptions, or just reporting the findings?
questions.context: This clarifies the Supplier's role regarding EA deviations and who is accountable for resolving issues.
questions.source_text: "Enterprise architecture standards & guidelines"
questions.boundary_item: "Enterprise architecture standards & guidelines"

questions.item: "Creating future state architecture"
questions.question: What specific architectural views (e.g., conceptual, logical, physical) and deliverables (e.g., diagrams, documentation) are required for the future state architecture? Is there a defined template or standard to be used?
questions.context: Defining the required level of detail and artifacts ensures the future state architecture meets Travelers' needs and prevents rework.
questions.source_text: "Creating future state architecture"
questions.boundary_item: "Creating future state architecture"

questions.item: "Create a engagement plan & Approach"
questions.question: Can you provide examples of 'possible risks' and 'challenges' that Travelers anticipates and would like to see addressed in the engagement plan?
questions.context: Specificity reduces the risk of the Supplier focusing on irrelevant concerns and missing critical risk areas. It also helps level-set expectations.
questions.source_text: "Create a engagement plan & Approach"
questions.boundary_item: "Create a engagement plan & Approach"

questions.item: "Qualitative and quantitative success metrics"
questions.question: Who at Travelers is responsible for defining and approving the qualitative and quantitative success metrics, and what is the expected timeline for this activity?
questions.context: Knowing who owns the definition of the success metrics and the timeline for completion are critical to project planning and delivery. Understanding the process by which they are selected avoids late scope changes.
questions.source_text: "Qualitative and quantitative success metrics"
questions.boundary_item: "Qualitative and quantitative success metrics"

questions.item: "Current Business Processes captured as Information Flows and System Flows"
questions.question: Can Travelers provide a list or prioritization of the key business processes for which information and system flows must be captured? Are there any existing process maps or documentation that the Supplier can leverage?
questions.context: Limiting the scope of process mapping prevents excessive effort on low-priority processes and allows the Supplier to focus on the most critical areas.
questions.source_text: "Current Business Processes captured as Information Flows and System Flows"
questions.boundary_item: "Current Business Processes captured as Information Flows and System Flows"

questions.item: "Pain Points, Constraints and Opportunities"
questions.question: Can Travelers provide specific examples of the types of 'pain points', 'constraints', and 'opportunities' that are relevant to this engagement?
questions.context: Provides context for prioritization and documentation, increasing confidence in appropriate resource allocation. Defining scope prevents subjective scope creep.
questions.source_text: "Pain Points, Constraints and Opportunities"
questions.boundary_item: "Pain Points, Constraints and Opportunities"

questions.item: "Regulatory and Compliance requirements"
questions.question: Is the Supplier solely responsible for *understanding* the regulatory and compliance requirements, or is the Supplier also expected to advise on or implement solutions to address those requirements?
questions.context: Clarifying the Supplier's role (understanding vs. advising/implementing) is crucial for determining resource allocation and responsibilities. Understanding only has significantly less implementation and testing implications.
questions.source_text: "Regulatory and Compliance requirements"
questions.boundary_item: "Regulatory and Compliance requirements"

questions.item: "Data Assessment"
questions.question: Can you specify the specific data domains or subject areas that are in scope for the data assessment?
questions.context: Defining the scope prevents scope creep and focuses the assessment on the most critical data assets.
questions.source_text: "Data Assessment"
questions.boundary_item: "Data Assessment"

questions.item: "Guiding Principles such as scalability, security, interoperability, and user experience"
questions.question: How will these guiding principles be measured and validated to ensure that the proposed architecture and implementation meet Travelers' requirements?
questions.context: Without defined metrics or validation methods, these principles are subjective and open to interpretation, potentially leading to disputes during acceptance testing.
questions.source_text: "Guiding Principles such as scalability, security, interoperability, and user experience"
questions.boundary_item: "Guiding Principles such as scalability, security, interoperability, and user experience"

questions.item: "Application of Well Architected Guidelines and Principles"
questions.question: What are the specific acceptance criteria that will be used to determine whether the Well Architected Guidelines and Principles have been adequately applied?
questions.context: Clear acceptance criteria will avoid subjective interpretations and ensure alignment between the Supplier's work and Travelers' expectations.
questions.source_text: "Application of Well Architected Guidelines and Principles"
questions.boundary_item: "Application of Well Architected Guidelines and Principles"

questions.item: "Technology Stack Fitment consistent with Travelers approved products, platforms and tools"
questions.question: If the Supplier identifies a functional gap where no existing Travelers-approved tools are suitable, what is the process for proposing and potentially implementing a new tool or platform?
questions.context: This clarifies the process for handling situations where approved tools are insufficient, preventing project delays and ensuring alignment with Travelers' IT standards.
questions.source_text: "Technology Stack Fitment consistent with Travelers approved products, platforms and tools"
questions.boundary_item: "Technology Stack Fitment consistent with Travelers approved products, platforms and tools"

questions.item: "Data Migration Approach with potentially a phased migration that includes a pilot/test environment before full-scale deployment"
questions.question: What are the specific size and scope requirements for the pilot/test environment, and what percentage of the total data should be included in the pilot migration?
questions.context: Knowing the size and scope of the pilot test environment helps to estimate the level of effort and infrastructure required.
questions.source_text: "Data Migration Approach with potentially a phased migration that includes a pilot/test environment before full-scale deployment"
questions.boundary_item: "Data Migration Approach with potentially a phased migration that includes a pilot/test environment before full-scale deployment"

questions.item: "Rough Order of Magnitude (RoM) estimates"
questions.question: What is the acceptable percentage range of variance (e.g., +/- 25%) for the RoM estimates?
questions.context: Specifying the acceptable variance will help Travelers understand the level of uncertainty in the estimates and avoid misunderstandings.
questions.source_text: "Rough Order of Magnitude (RoM) estimates"
questions.boundary_item: "Rough Order of Magnitude (RoM) estimates"

questions.item: "Governance and Continuous Improvement Framework"
questions.question: Does Travelers have a preferred continuous improvement framework (e.g., ITIL, COBIT) that the Supplier should recommend, and what is the expected level of detail for the recommendations?
questions.context: This ensures alignment with Travelers' existing governance practices and clarifies the scope of the recommendations.
questions.source_text: "Governance and Continuous Improvement Framework"
questions.boundary_item: "Governance and Continuous Improvement Framework"

questions.item: "Travelers will provide necessary access to network and systems to Supplier associates"
questions.question: What is the standard method of access (e.g., VPN, Citrix) provided to Supplier associates, and what is the typical turnaround time for processing access requests?
questions.context: Knowing the access method and turnaround time helps the Supplier plan resource onboarding and avoid project delays.
questions.source_text: "Travelers will provide necessary access to network and systems to Supplier associates"
questions.boundary_item: "Travelers will provide necessary access to network and systems to Supplier associates"

questions.item: "Appropriate authorizations"
questions.question: Can Travelers provide a list of specific individuals or roles who can provide the 'appropriate authorizations' required for the project?
questions.context: Identifies who has the authority to make key decisions, and what is considered an acceptable approver. Lack of clarity can cause confusion and wasted time.
questions.source_text: "Appropriate authorizations"
questions.boundary_item: "Appropriate authorizations"

questions.item: "Delays due to access issues, dependency on other teams"
questions.question: What is the escalation process for resolving delays caused by access issues or dependencies on other Travelers teams?
questions.context: Establishing an escalation process ensures that delays are addressed promptly and prevents them from impacting the project timeline.
questions.source_text: "Delays due to access issues, dependency on other teams"
questions.boundary_item: "Delays due to access issues, dependency on other teams"

questions.item: "It is assumed that there would be a Point of Contact (POC) from Travelers"
questions.question: What are the specific responsibilities and decision-making authority of the Travelers Point of Contact (POC)?
questions.context: Defining the POC's role prevents ambiguity and ensures the Supplier has a clear point of contact for resolving issues.
questions.source_text: "It is assumed that there would be a Point of Contact (POC) from Travelers"
questions.boundary_item: "It is assumed that there would be a Point of Contact (POC) from Travelers"

questions.item: "Thorough justification"
questions.question: What specific criteria or level of detail is required for a 'thorough justification' of software source code modifications?
questions.context: Reduces ambiguity and helps the Supplier to determine the appropriate amount of analysis and documentation effort. This minimizes disputes.
questions.source_text: "Thorough justification"
questions.boundary_item: "Thorough justification"

questions.item: "The supplier will revisit the contract if there are any additions found during the discovery"
questions.question: What specific types of 'additions' or changes discovered during discovery would trigger a change request to the contract? Is there a defined threshold (e.g., in terms of hours or cost)?
questions.context: This defines clear boundaries for when a contract renegotiation is necessary, preventing scope creep and ensuring fair compensation for additional work.
questions.source_text: "The supplier will revisit the contract if there are any additions found during the discovery"
questions.boundary_item: "The supplier will revisit the contract if there are any additions found during the discovery"

questions.item: "Travelers’ team members (Managers) are empowered to make decisions"
questions.question: What is the specific scope of decision-making authority granted to Travelers' team members (Managers) on this project?
questions.context: The decisions that a manager can make should be listed to set expectations
questions.source_text: "Travelers’ team members (Managers) are empowered to make decisions"
questions.boundary_item: "Travelers’ team members (Managers) are empowered to make decisions"

questions.item: "Travelers’ senior management will be available on a timely basis for reviews and decisions"
questions.question: What constitutes a 'timely basis' for senior management reviews and decisions (e.g., within 24 hours, within 2 business days)?
questions.context: Providing more detail about when the team should expect to hear back on project decisions is important
questions.source_text: "Travelers’ senior management will be available on a timely basis for reviews and decisions"
questions.boundary_item: "Travelers’ senior management will be available on a timely basis for reviews and decisions"

questions.item: "The stated resources and efforts estimation are based on the scope mentioned in the document"
questions.question: Where in the document are the specific resource and effort estimations located?
questions.context: The document is referencing information that is not available. The effort estimations may affect the outcome of the project, especially is not factored in properly
questions.source_text: "The stated resources and efforts estimation are based on the scope mentioned in the document"
questions.boundary_item: "The stated resources and efforts estimation are based on the scope mentioned in the document"

questions.item: "All the documents / deliverables submitted after each phase completion should be approved by Travelers within two (2) days of completion"
questions.question: What happens if the deliverable is not accepted within the two (2) day window? Does this impact project timelines, and what is the Supplier's recourse?
questions.context: Clarity is needed to avoid downstream delays and set expectations on the acceptance timeline.
questions.source_text: "All the documents / deliverables submitted after each phase completion should be approved by Travelers within two (2) days of completion"
questions.boundary_item: "All the documents / deliverables submitted after each phase completion should be approved by Travelers within two (2) days of completion"

questions.question: What are the non-functional requirements (NFRs) for Flowmart, specifically regarding performance, scalability, availability, and disaster recovery, and how will these be validated throughout the modernization process?
questions.context: The SOW mentions "Well Architected Guidelines" and "scalability" but lacks concrete performance targets (e.g., response times, throughput, concurrent users).  Without defined NFRs and a validation plan, the modernized system may not meet business needs and could lead to costly rework later.  It's crucial to understand the expected load, peak usage scenarios, and required uptime to design an appropriate architecture.
questions.target_stakeholder: Technical Lead, Enterprise Architect, Business Analyst

questions.question: The SOW mentions 'Disposition of current features/capabilities, especially legacy features.' What is the detailed plan for handling legacy data and functionalities during the migration, including data archiving, decommissioning strategies, and plans to mitigate risks associated with data loss or corruption during migration? What are the RTO and RPO objectives?
questions.context: Migrating legacy data and functionalities is a major risk in modernization projects. A robust data migration plan, including testing and validation of migrated data, is essential.  Failing to address this could result in data loss, system instability, and business disruption.
questions.target_stakeholder: Data Architect, Database Administrator, Technical Lead

questions.question: What specific security standards and compliance requirements (e.g., GDPR, CCPA, PCI DSS, or internal security policies) apply to Flowmart and its data, and how will the modernized system ensure adherence to these requirements throughout the development lifecycle and post-deployment?
questions.context: The SOW mentions 'Regulatory and Compliance requirements' and 'security requirements' but doesn't detail the specific standards. Non-compliance can lead to significant legal and financial penalties.  A clear understanding of these requirements and a plan for ensuring compliance (e.g., data encryption, access controls, audit trails) is critical.
questions.target_stakeholder: Security Architect, Compliance Officer, Technical Lead

questions.question: What is the detailed integration strategy for Flowmart with existing systems (Small Commercial system like – Select, Ag, NL/NF), including specific APIs, data formats, and error handling mechanisms? How will integration testing be conducted to ensure seamless data flow and functionality across all integrated systems?
questions.context: The SOW mentions systems integrated with Flowmart but lacks details on the integration approach.  Poor integration can lead to data inconsistencies, system failures, and user frustration. A well-defined integration strategy and thorough testing are crucial for success.
questions.target_stakeholder: Integration Architect, Technical Lead, System Owners

questions.question: What are the Service Level Agreements (SLAs) for the modernized Flowmart system, including uptime, response times, and data availability? How will these SLAs be monitored and enforced post-deployment, and what are the escalation procedures for SLA breaches?
questions.context: The SOW mentions 'Well Architected Guidelines (Performance Efficiency, Security, Operational Excellence, Reliability, Cost Optimization/FinOps, Sustainability)' but not the specific service levels expected. Clear SLAs are essential for managing user expectations and ensuring system reliability.  Without defined SLAs and monitoring mechanisms, it's difficult to assess the success of the modernization effort and ensure ongoing system performance.
questions.target_stakeholder: Operations Team, Product Owner, Business Analyst
